intro: Lippia megapotamica, commonly known as Mexican blue sage, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in open woodlands or along riverbanks. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Lippia megapotamica is also known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun conditions.
